content:
Google Timeline is a powerful tool for visualizing your travel history. Here are some tips to help you make the most out of it:

1. **Accessing Google Timeline**: Go to the Google Maps website, click on the menu icon (three horizontal lines), and select "Your Timeline." You can also access it on the Google Maps mobile app by tapping the profile picture or initial, then selecting "Your Timeline."
2. **Filtering by date range**: Use the calendar icon at the top left corner to select a specific date range. This will help you focus on a particular period, like a specific month or year.
3. **Categorizing trips**: Google Timeline doesn't have a built-in categorization feature, but you can use the "Label" feature to add custom labels to your trips. Click on a trip, then click the three vertical dots, and select "Add label." You can add labels like "Work," "Vacation," "Family Visit," or "Business Trip."
4. **Identifying trip types**: Look for the icons on the timeline to identify the type of trip:
	* A plane icon indicates a flight.
	* A car icon indicates a road trip.
	* A walking icon indicates a local trip or daily commute.
	* A train icon indicates a train journey.
5. **Viewing trip details**: Click on a trip to view more details, including:
	* Trip duration
	* Distance traveled
	* Modes of transportation used
	* Places visited
6. **Finding frequent destinations**: Look for clusters of trips to specific locations to identify your most frequent destinations.
7. **Exporting data**: You can export your location history data as a KML file, which can be imported into other mapping tools or spreadsheets for further analysis.
8. **Deleting or editing trips**: If you want to remove or correct a trip, click the three vertical dots and select "Delete" or "Edit."
9. **Using the map view**: Switch to the map view by clicking the map icon at the top right corner. This will help you visualize your trips on a map and see the routes you've taken.
10. **Setting up reminders**: You can set up reminders for upcoming trips by clicking the "Remind me" button on a trip.

By using these features, you'll be able to get a better understanding of your travel patterns, identify frequent destinations, and even plan your next trip more efficiently.

Have fun exploring your travel history, and I hope you have a great time in Denver!
